channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 30-40 inch pot on Denmark Hill by street lighting #251142, 4th January
item.description:
There are multiple pot holes and what seems to look like water in the road from a blocked drain. Water is covering a pot At the end of Ferndene Road, leading onto Denmark hill that is where the pot hole is located. I noticed the issue when it pierced my tyre at around 1:00am on 4/01/2026 I logged this last night but was unable to gather any photos as I needed to drive the car to a safe location before my tyre fully deflated. The reference for this is - FixMyStreet ref: 8622338.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-36, Denmark Hill, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rectory Place - litter pick required, 4th January
item.description:
There is rubbish and dead leaves everywhere. These tickets keep immediately getting closed down and marked as ‘fixed’ when they are not. I have taken a screenshot of this. This part of Greenwich simply does not get the time, care and attention the Council provide in central Greenwich.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rectory Place, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): FP82, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Continuous water leaking onto pavement on Montpelier Way, 4th January
item.description:
For some reason water is always leaking from under a fence onto the pavement on Montpelier Way. In normal times it is dangerously slippery - both my partner and I have slipped over trying to walk along the pavement here - but in freezing conditions it could be lethal. This has been the case for months if not years. Can something be done about it please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpelier Way, Brent Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp metal protruding Wooden slating just past post 2, 4th January
item.description:
There is a piece of metal protruding from the wooden slatting on the floor just past trail post number 2 (as shown in pictures). Pressed down as best as and covered with branches until fixed as this could injure a human or animal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duggan Drive, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Build-up of waste, flytipping and bulky items, 4th January
item.description:
There is a big build-up of household waste and bulky items by the two bin areas at Eldon House. I have just tidied it at least so the bin men can differentiate refuse from bulky items collection. Please kindly arrange removal of bulky items asap. Please note: One large wheelie bin was removed and not replaced approx 8 weeks ago - we really need a replacement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Loughborough Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement leading down from Grove Terrace to pavement along Highgate Road, 4th January
item.description:
I am a wheelchair user and a local resident at 1 Arco Walk. I cannot use this cut through pavement as there is no ramp on it. Appreciate if this can be looked into. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highgate Road, Dartmouth Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
